Package GameState

Class GameBoardState

java.lang.Object
GameState.GameBoardState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Node
public class GameBoardState extends Object implements Serializable
GameState class which holds a local game state represented as a 2d matrix. the game state values. Note Expected Range of values 0 = empty 2 = white queen 1 = black queen 3 = arrow Note: size is not 10 because input also includes the labeling from 1-10 and a-j for gui which is why BOARD_WIDTH and BOARD_HIEGHT are 11.
See Also:

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameBoardState(int[][] gameBoard)
    create a new game state from a game board that is either 11x11 to be down-sized to 10x10 or deep copy a 10x10 game board
    GameBoardState(ArrayList<Integer> gameBoard)
    take in a 121 arraylist of integer and transforms it into a readable 11x11 game board were positions are located between then down-sized to a 10x10 gamebaord.

    • GameBoardState

      public GameBoardState(ArrayList<Integer> gameBoard)
      take in a 121 arraylist of integer and transforms it into a readable 11x11 game board were positions are located between then down-sized to a 10x10 gamebaord. EFFECTS: currentBaord, creates 2d array representation of the game board. Modifies: currentBoard
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - is list of integers collected from AmazonsGameMessage.GAME_STATE

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      EFFECTS: sums the values in each row by the rows index and then sums the column by the column index {X1j +X2j + xnj} * Xj this forms the board 10x10 into a single integer value
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • print

      public void print()
      print to console currentBoard as matrix prints the representation with the square 1a as top left corner. which makes the console representation flip'd on the x-axs in relation to the GUI.

    • MoveQueen

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> MoveQueen(int queenColor, int[] oldPosXY, int[] newPosXY, int[] newArrowPos)
      Deprecated.
      To be Removed EFFECTS: Moves a single Queen and shoots a arrow. MODIFIES: queenPosWhite2 or queenPosBlack1, CurrentBoard
      Parameters:
      queenColor - the queen color to select 1 is white 2 is black
      oldPosXY - is the current queens position as a (x,y) pair
      newPosXY - is the new desired position of the queen as a (x,y) pair
      newArrowPos - is the desired Arrow position as a (x,y) pair.
      Returns:
      a Array-list object that contains that data to send to server index 0 = current queen position index 1 = new queen Position index 3 = new arrow position

    • countQueens

      public int[] countQueens()
      EFFECTS: count the the number of queens on both sides expected their should always be four of each.
      Returns:
      returns 2d array position 0 is white queen position 1 is black queen

    • updateQueenPoses

    • checkIfPathIsClear

      public boolean checkIfPathIsClear(int[] pos1, int[] pos2)
      checks if their is a clear line between two positions such that no obstacle is in the path and its a straight either vertical or horizaontal or diagonal
      Parameters:
      pos1 - start position
      pos2 - end position
      Returns:
      true if the path is straight and no obstacle is in the way

    • H1

      public double H1(int queenColor)
      heuristic1: looks at all the tiles around the queens. If the tiles dont = 1 then we add to each teams score we then return sumEnemyteam - sumOurteam
      Parameters:
      queenColor - the color of which queens which are ours

    • H2

      public double H2(int QueenColor)
      this heuristic will see all the moves the other team can make in comparison to the moves we can make
      Parameters:
      QueenColor - our queen color
      Returns:
      utility value higher is better

    • H3

      public double H3(int color, double wieght)
      heuristic 3 is a kill heuristic that only triggers when an emeny queen is surrounded by arrow except a single tile which is the 8 tile and is the move this board represents if it does apply the wieghted value to the Node
      Parameters:
      color - : out team color
      wieght - : how much priority this move will have over others
      Returns:
      utility value based on the weight param

    • H5

      public double H5(int color)
      Arrow placer heuristic that give priority to moves that place an arrow adjacent to a enemy queen. with placing higher priority to states that have more objects next to a enemy queen
      Parameters:
      color - : color of team to calculate for
      Returns:
      number blocked tiles around enemy queen

    • H4

      public double H4()
      escape heuristic that determines how much free space is around the current move vs its old move
      Returns:
      utility value

    • H6

      public double H6()
      counts the number of space it can possibly go to
      Returns:
      total space it can go to
